main event: A patrolman in Davenport, Iowa observed an unidentified flying object on January 27, 1953, which appeared to be a bright elliptical light that hovered and then maneuvered for about 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be several hundred feet in size and reached speeds of nearly 100 MPH before disappearing.,It was visible for about 10 minutes and moved in a northerly direction with a rocking motion.,The object was first seen at the horizon and was at an estimated height of several hundred feet.,No sound was reported from the object during the observation.,The object was not photographed, and there was no physical evidence collected.
witness description: Patrolman from the Davenport Police Department
